page.title: 05CHANGING TIMES
page.content: The village changed quite a lot when the airbase was built.Many of the men from Cosford came to the village and married the ladies from Albrighton. After the war traffic increased greatly making the village a very busy and dangerous place.In 1958 a bypass was built.Albrighton is a dormitory village for the West Midlands. There was a good bus and train service but both have been reduced now. In the last century there were 9 village cobblers, and 5 malt houses.There are now no cobblers and the last malt house was burnt down in 1972.In 1957 the old school in Station Road was closed because in 1952 a modern school had been built to cope with the increasing population.Later a second school had to be built to cope with increasing numbers.
